analysis.summary: Data breach notification requirement with critical severity mandating immediate written notification to Data Protection Authority without specified deadline, indicating regulatory compliance obligation likely under GDPR or similar framework.
insights: Absence of explicit deadline combined with 'immediate' requirement suggests GDPR 72-hour notification window applies
Critical severity classification aligns with personal data breach involving high risk to individuals' rights
Data Protection Authority designation indicates EU/EEA jurisdiction or GDPR-influenced legislation
Written notification requirement implies formal documentation and record-keeping obligations
Lack of specified recipients beyond DPA suggests additional stakeholder notifications may be required
recommendations: Activate incident response team within 1 hour and begin breach assessment documentation
Prepare initial notification to DPA within 24 hours even if investigation incomplete
Document breach discovery timestamp as 72-hour clock starts from awareness not occurrence
Assess if breach poses high risk to individuals requiring additional data subject notifications
Maintain detailed breach register including nature of data compromised and estimated affected individuals
Engage legal counsel specialized in data protection to ensure notification completeness
Prepare for potential follow-up requirements including remediation plans and compliance audits
